result.execSummary:
All charges against Nicholas M. Smith in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas M. Smith is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas M. Smith

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas M. Smith in court. Attorney Vincent Kurta for Attorney John Anthony Ward in court for Nicholas M. Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: ST called witness KPD Ofc Luke Hofmann; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Kurta. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found not found in Ct 1; Court dismisses Ct 1 without prejudice.   No probable cause found for Ct 2; Ct 2 dismissed without prejudice..   Entire case is dismissed without prejudice.
